text: Thanks for the response <@U38EZFVFE>. The problem is the thank you message controls on the HubSpot form tool gives limited rich txt options. We can bold and link elements, but without the ability to access the source code we can't add roles to the paragraph tag.

Ahhhhh. Interesting. Looks like when the thank you message is controlled on the form settings, the rich text functionality is limited. When a form is placed in a page template, the thank you message is the full rich text editor. Thank very much, I will try that.

Ok team, here is my update. Using the full rich text editor when a form is managed on a template or on a page, you can add <p role="status">Thanks...

This will successfully deliver the thank you message for screen readers without requiring they navigate back one step to hear the thank you message.

Update. I recommend using role="status" rather than role="dialog".

Dialog and AlertDialog indicate there is a separate focasable element like a popup window. For an inline thank you message, role="status" seems best.

:heart:
